description: From Middle English restreinen, a borrowing from Old French restreindre, from Latin rēstringere, present active infinitive of rēstringō (“fasten, tighten”).

verbs.description: restrain (third-person singular simple present restrains, present participle restraining, simple past and past participle restrained)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To control or keep in check.
examples: As with vicarious mismenstruation, the abnormal cessation only requires strict attention to the general health, with such measures to restrain hemorrhage as have already been indicated.
He was restrained by the straitjacket.

verbs.description: restrain (third-person singular simple present restrains, present participle restraining, simple past and past participle restrained)

examples: Squeeze the juice from 3 oranges and let the juice stand. Then pour it off, strain, and mix with the syrup. Restrain the liquid and chill in a mold.
